DataElement.preferredName: Baseline Target Lesion Sum Size Increase Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/not applicable indicator to ask if the baseline target lesion sum has increased in size.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Baseline Target Lesion Sum Size Increase
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A starting point to which things may be compared._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._The final aggregate amount._The physical magnitude of something._A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A starting point to which things may be compared.:An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final aggregate amount.:A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.:The physical magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: has the sum of the baseline t
